definition: to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)

sentences.english: He is down with a nasty bout of flu.
sentences.chinese: 他患了一陣子感冒，很難受。

sentences.english: She told them how much it grieved her that they were separated.
sentences.chinese: 她們斷絕往來，她感到無比難受。

sentences.english: I have a high fever and am feeling awful.
Can you imagine a fte worse than dancing with that guy?
sentences.chinese: 你能想象有什麼比和他跳舞更令人難受的事情嗎？

sentences.english: What makes me uncomfortable is that this after he has endured so much, the country has at last harmed him.
sentences.chinese: 我難受的，是這個國家終於傷害到了百般隱忍的他。

sentences.english: That hissing gets on my nerves.
The pain was o intolerable that I wished I were dead.
sentences.chinese: 這種疼痛實在難受，疼的我真想死。

sentences.english: "How many good memories are here, " she said. "It's very sad."
sentences.chinese: “有多少美好的回憶在這啊”她說“太難受了”。

sentences.english: Second: you start to feel bad about that part.
sentences.chinese: 然後你開始因爲那個地方感覺難受了。

sentences.english: Even a baby gets fussy when his mother is upset.
sentences.chinese: 即使是寶寶，當媽媽難受時他也會跟着難受。

sentences.english: Even a baby gets fussy when his mother is upset.
sentences.chinese: 即使是寶寶，當媽媽難受時他也會跟着難受。

sentences.english: It really bothers me when you are sad.
sentences.chinese: 你傷心的時候我真替你難受。

sentences.english: Traveling thousands of miles in a comppskillicipingested car was pretty rough.
sentences.chinese: 坐着小型車旅行數千裏實在是太難受了。

sentences.english: Privation of the company of all other human beings is a serious hardship.
sentences.chinese: 喪失和他人交往的機會是一件很難受的事情。
是令人難受的愧疚之情？

sentences.english: What time of day is hardest for you?

definition: to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
to intertwine/to band together (with)/to link up (with)/twisted/tangled/confused/to be at a loss
to feel/to become aware of/feeling/sense/perception/CL:個|个[ge4]
there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it
to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
